message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Vote: "the Way" for 道 in block quote?">
Quick check: for 道 in the Laozi block quote, do we use "the Way" (Ivanhoe/Lau/Chan standard) or "Dao" (romanized)?

Note: in the author's own analysis, we may use "Dao" as a romanized term. The question is specifically about the block quote.

YES = "the Way" in the block quote
NO = something else (say what)

One word answer.
</teammate-message>

input.summary: NO — use Dao throughout, no split
input.content: NO. Use "Dao" in the block quote too — same consistency argument as 仁/义/礼. If we use "the Way" in the quote and "Dao" in the analysis, that is one more split the reader must track. And "Dao" is well-established enough in English that no reader of philosophical prose will stumble on it.

routing.summary: NO — use Dao throughout, no split
routing.content: NO. Use "Dao" in the block quote too — same consistency argument as 仁/义/礼. If we use "the Way" in the quote and "Dao" in the analysis, that is one more split the reader must track. And "Dao" is well-established enough in English that no reader of philosophical prose will stumble on it.

content.text: Voted NO on "the Way" — recommended "Dao" in the block quote for consistency, same argument as the other terms. Standing by.
